Over  people attended the memorial service for Garth Sangree UNF mechanical engineering senior who went missing while kayaking in Jacksonville Beach last Saturday Jan PERIOD . entitled Celebration of a Short Life Well Lived the service included a full band and words from his pastors at Chets Creek Church Glenn Reese and Mark Smith as well as his friend Kevin Todd and Baptist Collegiate Ministries Minister Barry Sproles PERIOD The service was held at the Robinson Theater on Jan PERIOD  from  p.m PERIOD to  p.m PERIOD

Each spoke of Sangrees faith as well as his compassionate nature for those around him PERIOD

He took the time to love people no matter how busy he was and he was always busy PERIOD When I think of him I think of a man loved by God Todd said PERIOD

Sangree was known for his work with BCM where he played drums for the band PERIOD

Pastor Mark Smith remembers Sangrees dedication to his faith PERIOD He said When he was in kindergarten he started a tradition it was simple PERIOD On every Easter Sunday he would wake up early and watch the sun rise PERIOD Even when he couldnt be with his family he would send pictures of the sunrise from the beach to them PERIOD He watched the sunrise every Easter for  years. his family asks in lieu of flowers that donations be made to Jacksonville Baptist Collegiate Ministries Jacksonville Baptist Association  University Blvd PERIOD S. Jacksonville Fla PERIOD  PERIOD
